title: How to Draw a Portrait of a Woman

steps.headline: Draw a circle for the head.
Sketch a cross-like lines.
Then, sketch 3 guidelines for the jaw.
steps.description: It should look like a trapezoid or a cup.

steps.headline: Sketch the guidelines for the nose and the mouth.
Draw the jaw using a pen or any medium for drawing.
steps.description: Remember that this time, it is not a draft.

steps.headline: Draw the neck and the ears.
steps.description: The two lines for the neck should be from the side of the jaw. The ears should be placed between the top horizontal line of the face guideline to the mid-part of the second and third line.

steps.headline: Draw the basic features of the face starting with the eyes.
steps.description: It should be placed on the first horizontal line of the face guidelines.

steps.headline: Add the nose.
Draw the mouth.
steps.description: You could experiment on this as well as the other features of the face depending on the expression you want it to depict.

steps.headline: Draw the hair.
steps.description: The hair should be drawn originating outside the circle of the head.

steps.headline: Erase the draft lines.
Add the eyebrow once the shape of the hair is made.
Add more details to the face, neck and shoulder.
steps.description: Add more shadowing and shape to the face features.

steps.headline: Draw more details to the hair.
Color it as you wish.
Start by drawing the basic features of the side view of the face.
steps.description: These circles and lines are to help you make it accurate and recognize the features.

steps.headline: Add the features of the face, and erase the line in front of the face.
steps.description: Then draw curved lines so it looks like a face. Add some rough hair.

steps.headline: Sketch additional head details.
steps.description: Draw the hair properly, then add the ear, eye, and lips.

steps.headline: Draw the eyelashes around the eyes and add eyebrows above.
Darken the features.
steps.description: Erase the circles you drew for guides. (This is tricky work, so be  careful.) Next, reinforce the features to make them more realistic. Add lines on the head to shade the hair.

steps.headline: You now have your portrait.

tyn: Paper-- size A4 (A3 or A5 optional)
text: Front view Draw a circle for the head.  Sketch a cross-like lines.  Then, sketch 3 guidelines for the jaw. It should look like a trapezoid or a cup. Sketch the guidelines for the nose and the mouth.  Draw the jaw using a pen or any medium for drawing. Remember that this time, it is not a draft. Draw the neck and the ears. The two lines for the neck should be from the side of the jaw. The ears should be placed between the top horizontal line of the face guideline to the mid-part of the second and third line. Draw the basic features of the face starting with the eyes. It should be placed on the first horizontal line of the face guidelines. Add the nose.  Draw the mouth. You could experiment on this as well as the other features of the face depending on the expression you want it to depict. Draw the hair. The hair should be drawn originating outside the circle of the head. Erase the draft lines.  Add the eyebrow once the shape of the hair is made.  Add more details to the face, neck and shoulder. Add more shadowing and shape to the face features. Draw more details to the hair. This might include drawing curls. Color it as you wish.  Side View Start by drawing the basic features of the side view of the face. These circles and lines are to help you make it accurate and recognize the features. Add the features of the face, and erase the line in front of the face. Then draw curved lines so it looks like a face. Add some rough hair. Sketch additional head details. Draw the hair properly, then add the ear, eye, and lips. Draw the eyelashes around the eyes and add eyebrows above.  Darken the features. Erase the circles you drew for guides. (This is tricky work, so be  careful.) Next, reinforce the features to make them more realistic. Add lines on the head to shade the hair. You now have your portrait. Enjoy!
sentences: Front view Draw a circle for the head.
Sketch a cross-like lines.
Then, sketch 3 guidelines for the jaw.
It should look like a trapezoid or a cup.
Sketch the guidelines for the nose and the mouth.
Draw the jaw using a pen or any medium for drawing.
Remember that this time, it is not a draft.
Draw the neck and the ears.
The two lines for the neck should be from the side of the jaw.
The ears should be placed between the top horizontal line of the face guideline to the mid-part of the second and third line.
Draw the basic features of the face starting with the eyes.
It should be placed on the first horizontal line of the face guidelines.
Add the nose.
Draw the mouth.
You could experiment on this as well as the other features of the face depending on the expression you want it to depict.
Draw the hair.
The hair should be drawn originating outside the circle of the head.
Erase the draft lines.
Add the eyebrow once the shape of the hair is made.
Add more details to the face, neck and shoulder.
Add more shadowing and shape to the face features.
Draw more details to the hair.
This might include drawing curls.
Color it as you wish.
Side View Start by drawing the basic features of the side view of the face.
These circles and lines are to help you make it accurate and recognize the features.
Add the features of the face, and erase the line in front of the face.
Then draw curved lines so it looks like a face.
Add some rough hair.
Sketch additional head details.
Draw the hair properly, then add the ear, eye, and lips.
Draw the eyelashes around the eyes and add eyebrows above.
Darken the features.
Erase the circles you drew for guides.
(This is tricky work, so be  careful.)
Next, reinforce the features to make them more realistic.
Add lines on the head to shade the hair.
You now have your portrait.
Enjoy!
